title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a report parameter of type 'DateTime' in the BIRT report designer, and entering an invalid date string like '55/66/9999' in the 'default value' field, the value is accepted and stored without any validation or error message.
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject and display an error message for invalid date/time strings entered in the 'default value' field for a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Open the BIRT report designer. 2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'. 3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, for example, '55/66/9999'. 4. Save the report. The invalid date string should be rejected with an appropriate error message.
